sn35.97:1.1: “Negligence” (pamāda) is from a root meaning to be mad or drunk. It’s often used in an ethical context, but here the Buddha extends it throughout the path.
sn35.97:1.5: The discourse links “negligence” with the process of mental uplifting that leads to samādhi (see SN 12.23:3.11).
sn35.97:1.10: “Principles” (dhammā) such as the four noble truths, dependent origination, etc.
